Overall, a great place to grab lunch or dinner. I highly recommend it. The prices here are reasonable too. For two appetizers, a side of rice, a main dish and two drinks, the totally was just over $20 which is a pretty affordable meal for 2 people.
author: Sara S.

description: I was looking for a spot to have a light dinner after shopping. The pot stickers and hot and sour soup were more than filling. Potstickers were perfectly crispy on one side and soup was great. Clean and respectful service. I'll be back!
author: Anna V.

description: Long time eater, first time Yelper. Hunan House? More like Where The Fuck is my Waitres House. There was a super badaas heating plate built into the table but like guess what? Homeboy wouldnt even turn on. Turn down for what you ask? Turn down for Hunan house.
author: Garrett K.

description:
My boyfriend and I were walking around Chinatown for the day when we stumbled upon this restaurant. To be honest it looked clean, and we liked how pictures were posted outside of the  window displaying different dishes from  their menu. When we walked in we were seated immediately and given menus, the lady who sat us walked away and took her apron off and sat in a booth to eat .The menu has a lot of variety to choose from! We were waiting and waiting to be acknowledged by someone who works there and nothing. The restaurant wasn't busy, we looked around for someone or at least to make eye contact with someone. Nothing. We waited a good 15 minutes, only reason why we waited that long was because we were thirsty, from all the walking and hungry! Staff actually walked by us and didn't once make eye contact with us . I finally started putting my purse around my shoulder getting ready to leave when someone finally came to us! We ordered our waters. The waitress got us waters and walked away . A few minutes later she came back and took our orders. She was extremely rude, when I asked her specifically what the hot pot meal comes with she stared at me blankly, then pointed at the menu without saying anything and sighing . I told her that each section has a " meat , vegetable , broth etc " all I wanted to know is if we could choose from each section or if we could only choose a certain amount . She rolled her eyes and told me we could choose 5. I told her I didn't know and the menu didn't say which is why I asked . She didn't say anything or smile . She took our orders while in between taking a huge sigh.

The food came , it was good. The waitress never came to check on us, only to give us the check that my boyfriend requested. While we were eating , a gentleman who was a customer went to the front asking for water. The waitress we had told him she was getting them water. The customer  told the waitress   " You told us that a long time ago and have not once come back to check on us or bring us water." 

When my boyfriend and I heard that, it validated our feelings of frustration too with the service. After eating at the restaurant I looked up reviews and found out others too had similar experiences with bad service.

We will never come back here again!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I thought our meals were average and not worth the hype on Yelp, but they weren't bad. If you're looking for no frills, big portion Chinese then you may like it, but I'm sure this isn't the best SF Chinatown has to offer.
author: Lauren O.

description: This place is a very good place to get some good food. The place is roomy (although when I was there it was empty so this may not be accurate), and the atmosphere is decent. One major problem we experienced was the strong scent of cigarette smoke that was present the entire time. The food was very good with the garlic noodles and broccoli especially standing out. The prices were very appropriate for the portions of the food. The portions were pretty large, with three or four shared dishes easily filling a family of four heavy eaters. This is good as the food is pretty greasy. The location of this restaurant is very nice as it gives access to authentic oriental shops and stores. Speaking of authentic, most of the food reflects this perfectly, with frogs and intestines being available, but if you like classics like Mongolian beef and orange chicken you won't be lost.
author: Saif Z.

description: Excellent food & service! Love all the spicy dishes! Especially the seafood! Nice environment and atmosphere
author: Wing W.

description: Best Chinese I have ever had, but I've never had the privilege of living somewhere with legit Chinese food.   Establishment appeared family owned and everyone had their role.  Still, service suffered.  Seemed popular with local Asians, many dim sum items.  Don't be reluctant, tourist friendly and they have sesame chicken.  Hot and sour soup was especially good.
author: Daniel M.

description: Stopped on for lunch, ordered the dry fried green beans with pork and the orange peeled chicken...both were Outstanding!  Just the right spice on both...service was efficient and quick.  If your looking for a great place in Chinatown...it's right here!
author: Joshua N.

description: Excellent food and a little less busy than some of the other 4 * places on yelp. Prawn broccoli and cashew nut felt almost virtuous after a day pigging out in the city!!!
author: Lindsay S.

description: Best place to eat in San francisco Chinatown. Food was very delicious and fresh. Service was speedy and the waiters were patience. Surprisingly this place has fresh osyters and salmon not on the menu  if called well in advance ! Would recommends to everyone who visits chinatown.
author: Donny H.

description: Have been here twice and everything has been a hit. Especially enjoy the garlic snow peas and fried fish with explosive peppers. Clean place and good prices, a great place in Chinatown.
author: Adam S.

description: Terrible customer service. We were blatantly ignored by the employees for 40+ minutes, though there were only 2 other couples in the restaurant. The food wasn't even that good. This place is a bummer.
author: Kanye W.

description: This is a new restaurant. We had lunch. The food is very good. I had kung pao chicken and pot stickers, both excellent. Relaxed, quiet atmosphere. The staff could have been more friendly, but they were quick. I'd definitely eat there again.
author: Peter L.

description: I've only eaten here once so far, but it was a very good meal.  The restaurant is smallish, with a fairly simple, classy look.  The service was good, if a bit stiff, but they are only months old and still settling in I think - as soon as I made some small talk the smiles came out - overall service was fast and relatively attentive.  We were craving spicy on a dreary, Fall day and had Ma Po Tofu, Hot and Sour Soup and Explosive Fish.  All three were indeed spicy (the fish had a bed of at least fifty peppers!), and were among the best I've had, including Asia - all were intensely flavored with layers of spicy, numbing goodness from the peppers and peppercorns.  I can't wait to go back as the menu is large and has some pretty exotic items (frog, sea cucumbers, etc.) - well, maybe not, but kidding aside, some really appealing sounding dishes.  Beer is served in tall, iced glasses, which never hurts either.  The clientele when we were there, on a Sunday afternoon, were local Chinatown, local SF, and some tourists, so a nice mix, with quite a few Asian locals coming in for take out while we were there as well.  I have no doubt most folks would have a great meal here, particularly if they're looking for truly spicy.
author: Caelum S.
